summary:
Boxing is a sport where two people fight in a ring, wearing protective gear, and punching each other. It has a long history, possibly starting in ancient Ethiopia and spreading to Egypt, Greece, and Rome. Over time, boxing rules developed, with the modern version emerging in the 19th century.

There are different types of boxing, some allowing only fists, while others include kicks and strikes. It's an Olympic sport, with winners decided by judges' scores or a referee's decision if someone can't continue. Amateur boxing is also popular in international games.
title: Boxing
